description:
It's in a grungy area but the restaurant is pretty low key and often not too crowded. 

Food is 4 stars (except, their olive tapenade)

Service is 5 stars (very friendly and quick)
author: Adam L.

description:
Have you ever wanted to like something so badly, but you just couldn't do it no matter how much you tried?

For me, that neatly applied to La Briciola. One of the many intimate Italian restaurants in San Francisco, La Briciola seemingly offered an exquisite array of pasta dishes. Despite the higher-end cost (about $20+ for most items), my girlfriend and I gave this place a try in hopes of experiencing amazing Italian food. The restaurant was located on 3rd street near the freeway, so we only had to walk about 10 minutes to get there. Why not give it a shot right? 

Unfortunately, it didn't turn out the way we wanted. 

In terms of the menu options, La Briciola served a wide range of pasta creations to go along with appetizers and entrees. We were really intrigued by some of the bolder dishes such as their squid ink spaghetti. We ended up settling for two of their seasonal items: The Spinach Ravioli in Mushroom Cream Sauce and a Meat Lasagna. Here's what we thought of the experience:

-- MEDIOCRE FOOD, CONSIDERING PRICE --
If there was one takeaway from our food, it was that the average quality and lackluster portions definitely didn't justify the premium price. 

+ House Bread (8/10): Sadly, probably the best thing we ate here didn't even cost us a penny. Their complimentary bread was pretty darn good. It was hot, the olive oil dip was unique by actually having real bits of crushed olives, and I loved the crunchiness of each piece. Unfortunately, some pieces were unevenly cooked and had burnt marks. 

- Ravioli With Cream Sauce (6/10): This was just okay. I definitely felt cheated because, for almost $20, my plate only had like 10 pieces of ravioli at most. I ate that thing so fast, and even sipped up all the sauce, but it didn't satisfy my stomach. The ravioli pieces were just okay too - not hot enough and I felt like it was missing meat. Sauce was good and creamy, but it would've been better with more ingredients.

- Meat Lasagna (5/10): According to my girlfriend, this was way too oily. And you could see it! The tomato-based sauce was literally separating from the oil in front of our eyes. I mean the dish tasted fine (not the worst), and it came out hotter than my ravioli, but we've definitely had better for a much cheaper price point. Again, portion size here was really sad. 

-- GOOD ATMOSPHERE FOR DATE --
Regardless of the food, the setting was effectively suitable for a date night. Lighting was great, there was plenty of seating, and I enjoyed the music playing in the background as well. 

-- OKAY SERVICE, KINDA SLOW -- 
Employees here were nice, but I didn't really like the fact that they took their time to serve and approach us. Especially since we were one of the only customers at the restaurant, it was surprising that they were a bit sluggish.

For the price, I probably wouldn't come back to La Briciola. The food wasn't horrible per say, but I honestly feel like there are better options out there. I give this restaurant a "Tolerable, sufficient for sustenance" rating.

Eat well and prosper,
author: Bryan W.

description:
This place has gone downhill. I have been coming here for years and it's not what it used to be. They gave us burnt bread tonight. We said something, they gave us new bread and then served the same burnt bread to another table!

They were understaffed as well tonight. There was one waiter and one busboy for the whole restaurant. We were waiting for everything. 

Caesar salad was not good. Linguine Vongole was also not good - clams were not fresh and tasted/smelled fishy. The special lasagne was the only good part of the meal.

To top it all off, we asked for a to-go container, and the busboy gives us the container with the to-go bag inside the container - where the food goes!! Definitely not sanitary. See pic.

Needless to say, we won't be coming back here anytime soon, unfortunately.
author: Farrah L.

description:
I came here for a birthday dinner with my boyfriend and we decided to order three entrees and one dessert because we were starving! The restaurant offered us some free bread and olive oil with some kind of paste while we waited for our dishes to come out.

We decided to order the following dishes:

Gnocchi Sorrentina (5/5) - I love potato dumplings and cheese. They were especially tasty and chewy. I recommend this dish.
Lasagna di Carne (5/5) - The lasagna had a lot of sauce/flavor to it. This is more of a soft and moist lasagna. I recommend this dish.
Risotto al nero di seppia (5/5) - I love squid ink dishes. Since I've tried squid ink spaghetti before, I wanted to try it with risotto. The calamari and scallops were delicious. I highly recommend this dish if you like squid ink.
Cannoli (3/5) - This was my first time trying a cannoli and I wasn't too pleased with it. I didn't really like the sweet ricotta filling.

The restaurant is big enough to have small group seating, but I would recommend to make a reservation in advance if you have a larger group. The interior design is simple with dim lighting and candles on each table. The setting is casual, so you don't need to dress up fancy. The service was excellent. The food was delicious and the portion sizes are generous for an Italian restaurant. We couldn't finish all three of our main entrees, so we took home our leftovers. We had a great experience and were super pleased with the food. We would definitely come back here again!

I don't recommend driving to the restaurant because the restaurant is located on a busy street. Parking might be difficult, so it's best to find an alternative transportation solution.
author: Sylvia H.

description:
Definitely go for the hand made pasta. I had the gnocchi, and my friend had the mushroom tagliatelle. I though both were really great, with the soft, chewiness you expect from hand made pasta and the well rounded sauce they hopefully make in house. My friend preferred the gnocchi better; the consistency was lighter and the sauce was sweeter. 

We also added a chocolate cake to the end of our meal. I wouldn't necessarily recommend it, and we should have ordered the tiramisu instead (duh!), but we ate it anyway.
author: Sheewon B.

description:
I tend to eat things in packs, and this time it's al dente pasta. Like Cotogna last weekend, the pasta is super al dente (although slightly less so than Cotogna). 

I got the lamb ragu. The pasta was certainly impressive in length (9"+) and was just thick enough to have good bite. However, it was quite bland on its own. Given the slickness of the pasta, the lamb did not mix well with the pasta and sat at the bottom of the dish. The ground lamb did impart a lamb-y sort of smell to the pasta, but was quite bland (and lacking in salt). The tomato taste to the sauce was also quite light.

I can't comment on the service since I got takeout, but they were nice about letting me take a seat as I waited for my order. Cute interior. 

The bread that they included was some of the best bread I've had in a long time though! Chewy crust that had just enough moisture, combined with dense soft bread. I ate the entire portion they gave me, and that rarely happens with takeout bread.
author: Nicole H.

description:
Great for a last minute reservation - my colleague was able to reserve a table for 15 the day before. A small Italian restaurant in Soma, La Briciola was not busy and attended to us quickly. Their service was good. 

The food was okay. The Caesar salad and calamari starters were decent, nothing out of the ordinary and just what you would expect. I ordered the Tagliatelleai with mushrooms and truffle oil. It lacked the flavor I was looking for in a truffle dish, and the pasta was not pulled evenly, as some noodles were very thick and dough-y while others were thin. Another person in our party also thought the Orechiette dish was plain and dry. 

Other dishes ordered were lasagna, squid ink pasta, etc. so I'd be willing to come back and try something else.
author: Lillian B.

description: A group of friends and myself decided to come eat at La Briciola for one of my friends birthday celebration dinner. We had set a reservation for 6:30pm a few days prior to our visit. We come to see our tables had not even been set up yet when we arrived at 6:40pm. I'd understand if they were busy but there was only one other table in the restaurant. This was the least of my problems at this eatery. The staff was only friendly until they made a mistake on one of our orders after, they were rude. Worst of all by the end of our $300 dinner we all got food poisoning and we're forced to stay in our hotel all night instead of enjoying our weekend getaway. This place will make you sick don't waste your time or money please.
author: Taylor O.

description:
Pretty decent Italian food near our office. Came here with the crew for our Friday Lunch out and had a great meal. Everyone was satisfied with their meals, the service, and the quality. I tried some of the dishes and was not crazy about the penne carbonara- the bacon was too fatty and in large chunks, and the sauce was very creamy, which a carbonara should not be.

However, I did really enjoy my Gnocchi a la Sorrentina. I wanted a casual pasta dish to start my weekend right, and I got it! The gnocchi was delicious- large pillows slathered in a delish tomato sauce. I love cheese, and the chunks of mozzarella in the dish was a nice surprise.

Other dishes- the Ravioli with a butter sage sauce was very good, the Rigatoni with Sausage had great reviews. Again, not a fan of the Carbonara, but I didn't have to eat it!

Service was friendly. Would return!
author: Hannah S.

description:
Service was excellent and I loved that they started us off with an endless stream of bread and olive tapenade which I definitely OD on, but the pastas themselves were mediocre. I had the tagliolini di mare. The tagliolini didn't have the chewy consistency of homemade pasta that I always look forward to. The seafood was forgettable. 

Hopefully some improvement can be made here, as there is always a need for good Italian in the neighb.
author: Isabella S.

description: This just became my favorite Italian restaurant outside of Italy. How do I make such bold statement? Because this place is AMAAAAAAAAAAZINGLY DELICIOUS and I go to Italy once a year.  I was  pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food. I actually was invited here for my birthday ( yes that was a surprise too)  and what a surprise the small cozy restaurant turned out to be family owned (I met the owners) and they are Italian natives! No wonder the food is so darn delicious! This is a hidden gem in SF! Lots of surprises!
author: Javier B.

description: The last few times I've come here, it's really changed in terms of food quality and service. The last time I came here was with my sister and my bf. It was very difficult to get the attention of the server, even though the restaurant wasn't that busy. The food was all right, but definitely not the same as I remembered it. The pasta was overcooked and the food in general just wasn't as tasty as I expected. I'm a bit disappointed since the location was so convenient, but I guess I'll be getting my Italian fix elsewhere now.
author: Bianca C.

description:
Great homemade pasta w no crowds on a Saturday night in the summertime 

Walked here from park central hotel. Do exercise some caution if walking alone here at night or just Uber.

Comfy, tasteful, and not overly trendy space. 

Started w salad de campo(arugula, tomatoes, pecorino)- excellent w portion big enough for two. Then had stracietti(flat ribbon pasta) w lamb ragu. So damn good w a pleasant al denteness to pasta texture. Also had the ravioli which was equally as good. Finished off w super delectable homemade tiramisu.

Reasonably priced wines by the glass(for SF)
Good service
Two restrooms in back
Definitely not many tourists 

Would come again
author: Jimmy C.

description:
A pleasant neighborhood venue for Italian that has quite an extensive, reasonably priced menu. Whether soups, salads, antipasti, pasta, or entrees, there's plenty to choose from, and given the portions that you get, the prices are quite good.

To start, a burrata dish came with Parma prosciutto, cherry tomatoes, and arugula, and was quite savory and substantial. So much so that I was surprised that I still had room for pasta, which in my case was the orecchiette con salsiccia e rapini (ear-shaped pasta with sausage and broccoli rabe). Satisfyingly meaty and, again, enjoyably savory. 

The venue features both a bar area and a decently sized dining room. Service is courteous and attentive without being intrusive. It's by no means a trendy, blinged-out dining experience, but instead is a satisfying one that's all about substance.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Came here for a work function. It wasn't bad but it wasn't memorable either. Best part was that I didn't have to pay for it. 

We ordered a bunch of appetizers but I noticed a lot of them went untouched - looking at you calamari and weird pasta dumpling looking thing...

For my meal I ordered the squid ink pasta with seafood. It was okay. Noodles were overcooked, seafood was overcooked, sauce needed salt.

Staff were good about refilling waters and kitchen was great about having the meals come out together though. 

I dunno if I'd go back though. Maybe for another work function...
author: Mandi W.

description:
Ehhhhhh

It looked really nice from the outside and thought it would pretty decent because it had a solid 4 stars.

-tasted pretty bad
-not as filling and expensive for spaghetti, I don't mind it being expensive but at least make it taste well
-service was slow and seemed to be prejudiced (2 college students coming in)
-got an appetizer, looked okay online, tasted terrible in the end
-if you want spaghetti don't come here
-if you want good food don't come here
-if you want a good taste for buck don't come here

I don't understand why this place has 4 stars.. it's decent but not that great
author: Arthur K.

description: Great restaurant with yummy food, top notch service and amazing wines :) Good for date night, celebration or a party!
author: Marina O.

description: Just landed in SF and walked over to this amazing italian restaurant. Food and service are excellent, I highly recommend it.
author: Perry Y.

description: Great food. We came an hour before closing and we were in and out very fast. Service was great. Patient and attentive. The food was absolutely amazing! We got the sea bass ravioli in a lobster reduction and the hand cut pasta with beef ragú. Wow!!!! It was so great! Definitely a gem of a restaurant
author: Layla E.

description: This is a staple in our restaurant rotation.  Quaint, relaxing and tasty.  The Lasagna, lamb ragu or risotto are my faves. And the staff are always accommodating with a reasonably priced wine pairing that complements our meal.  As if that wasn't enough, they allow my kids (mostly well behaved) to be kids; with food tailored to them.  Love this spot.
author: Justin W.

description: Came here for dinner with a friend, she ordered mushroom ravioli and I ordered pesto gnocchi. Overall we enjoyed out meals, but it was kind of meh how we got seated in a corner next to the entrance. It was hard to wave down a server to even ask for more water! Now, the gnocchi I ordered I think its hand made(?) the gnocchi were slightly big for me, hence the flavor was unbalanced when I take a bite with the sauce. It was also kind of heavy on my stomach, I ate 1/3 of my gnocchi and couldn't take it anymore. I guess personal preference I would have liked it if the gnocchi was either smaller or curled so I can get more of the sauce. The ravioli was great! sad there weren't more.
author: Nina Y.

description:
This Italian restaurant is a gem in a sketchier part of town (at night). The dining area is small , but service is great and food is delicious! It might be wise to make a reservation if you're coming out of the way to try this restaurant, which is definitely worth the trip !

Table bread: On point.  But what blew me away was the olive tapenade they serve with the bread. DELICIOUS. 

Appetizer: the burrata was so good! It was my first time trying burrata, but the milky mozzarella cheese with the smoky prosciutto was an amazing combination. 

I recommend anything on their seafood menu. The flavor of the dishes I've tried are all spectacular. The Tagliolini di Mari is a delicious pasta dish with lots of seafood in it. The Caciucco came as a wonderful tomato based fishstock and tons of seafood, including crabs, mussels and scallops. Honestly I don't think you can go wrong with any of the primi or secondi. Also, the portions are rather large, so sharing is definitely possible！

And don't forget a glass of wine!
author: Cindy H.

description: One of the best Italian restaurants in San Francisco. The food is fresh and authentic.
author: Giovanni S.

description:
Came on a recommendation from the hotel concierge. When will I learn?  Nice decor, quiet little restaurant. Calamari was very tough and marinara sauce was unremarkable. Tagliolini di mare was ok. Not very flavorful. Several bits of loose clam shells in the sauce. Service was slow for a weeknight, with very few customers. The best part of the meal was the bread and olive tampenade.

In a city with many fantastic restaurants, this wasn't one of them on the night we visited.
author: David F.

description: Great meal with nice selection of wine for decent prices within SFO.   Nightly specials with freshly made pasta.  Easy walk from Marriott Marquis or Moscone.
author: Eria N Russ M.

description:
My friend and I came here for New Year's Eve and it was one of the worst dining experiences yet!

First, they were severely understaffed and it seemed that the manager was the one taking our orders - needless to say, service was very slow.

To start off, we both ordered a glass of wine and an assortment of bruschetta for our appetizer. The wines were tasty and the highlight of the night, and the bruschetta was not too shabby. We thought that the entrées would be delicious as well, but everything went downhill from there. I ordered the gnocchi with tomato sauce and basil, and my friend ordered the risotto. The portion sizes were humungous (think Cheesecake Factory portions), which would have been a great thing if the food was actually tasty. The gnocchi was very mediocre and slightly bland, and the risotto was nearly inedible. My friend had to force feed himself as both dishes cost around 20 dollars! The flavors were one-dimensional, but the risotto was a travesty of Italian cuisine - it tasted like a microwaved instant-mix.

To top it all off, there was a 30% surcharge because it was New Year's Eve! We felt jipped and would never recommend this to anyone! Save your money and find another Italian restaurant.
author: Brian C.

description: Hands down best lasagna ever..!! I can't compare it to anything I've ever had. Great service, red wine is Devine and soup is great on a cold, overcast or rainy day.
author: Josh G.

description: Delicious food! I can really tell each of the ingredients was of great quality! I really enjoyed the appetizers, the dressing on the salad was soo good! I dont know what they put on it, but was so tasty! My husband loved his dish, I couldnt try it because of the dairy, but he was very pleased with it, and he's so picky!! Cute place, definitely coming back!
author: Natali M.

description: Oh how I wanted to like you more :(  My friend and I used to go to Umbria all of the time until SF ran them out of the city and since then we have been trying to find an Umbria substitute so we thought we would try this place out.  First it is only beer and wine which is fine but the wine selection is pretty lacking and over priced for what you get.  I didn't care for either of the two glasses of red that I tried.  The burrata wrapped in prosciutto is worth one star in itself.  Delicious!  My friend did enjoy the pasta she ordered and I probably should have gone with the lamb ragu that everyone writes about.  I however got the wrapped veal in fontina cheese and white sauce with vegetables.  The white sauce was tasty and I covered my vegetables in it.  Now I love veal but for some reason this dish was a lot gamier than I would like.  I've never had veal like this before and I've ordered it at many restaurants.  The gaminess took away from the entire meal.  I'll give this place a try again in the future but I would probably opt for pasta.  Until then, we will continue our pursuit in looking for a new Umbria.
author: Amanda K.

description: This Italian restaurant is everything! The delicious food, kind service, authentic decor, central location and overall experience make up your own little slice of Italy right here in the Bay Area. I have only been here for lunch but this white tablecloth spot has a large and tasty lunch menu with a good selection of wines by the glass and by the bottle. My go-to dish is their prosciutto and mozzarella sandwich with fries and a small salad. YUM! La Briciola is a great place to bring a client or to celebrate a birthday or promotion.
author: Meredith R.

description:
My husband an I eat out a lot in San Francisco.  Trying all the new trendy restaurants and Bauer's Top 100 yearly pics, and yet this little Italian neighborhood restaurant is one of our favorites.  It is real Italian food with Italian owners and management and always so friendly.  The  pasta is home made, the smoked salmon divine and veal stuffed with cheese and ham is amazing. 

 I have loved everything we have had to eat.  Oh yes, the Italian bread is always fresh and the olive spread so yummy.  I am getting hungry just thinking about dinner last night.

I am a rave fan of this little piece of Italy close to our SF home base.

Thank you for keeping up the good work day in and day out.
author: Lisa S.

description: Amazing gnocchi and other fresh pasta. Antipasti were excellent as well. Went with a group of 8 and staff was friendly.
author: Max M.

description:
I had dinner here with two friends before watching Opera in the Park. We noticed this restaurant when we were walking by. Ambiance was nice. Some of the tables were filled, but we were able to score a seat. We had the :

1. Frittura di Calamari - calamari - the batter was on the lighter side accompanied  with marinara sauce
2. Spaghetti alla Costiera - black ink spaghetti with seafood. I wasn't a fan of the black ink spaghetti, it lacked the taste of the black ink. Seafood accompanied the dish nicely. 
3. Agnello al Brunello - lamb . The lamb with vegetables, such as carrots and potatoes accompanied really well with the sauce added.

Even thought the food was ok, the time getting our dishes was quite slow. We did have to tell them to rush it along since we were going to watch the opera.
author: Jennifer G.H. W.

description: I absolutely love this restaurant. Charming, great service, and my favorite ravioli in the city by far! Great spot for a romantic night.
author: Stephanie A.

description:
A friend and I randomly picked this place walking down the street when we suddenly were in the mood for Italian food. We settled here for convenience and a good looking menu! I admit I usually do a lot of research before eating out including what I would order so I was a bit out of my comfort zone. 

We order from the of the land side of the menu and  shared the lamb ragu and the orecchiette with sausage after quickly looking on Yelp and seeing what was popular and also tasty to us. 

Both pastas were cooked perfectly but I feel like there was nothing special about the dishes as a whole besides a good pasta base. The lamb ragu lacked depth in the sauce. The orecchiette was overly saturated in olive oil. I did like the broccoli rabe in the dish but it should not have been the star of the show. The food was fine but it was a bit pricey for that. Maybe I should have tried something from the sea to get a better idea of what this restaurant has to offer! 

Service was spotty--infrequent water refills and general check ins. I did appreciate though that they let us sit and talk for a while.
author: Emily P.

description:
I am disappointed with my meal at La Briciola and I feel frustrated because I wish I were writing a different type of review right now. 

The friendly waiter was the only redeeming quality of the meal that could even warrant a 1 star for this restaurant. I came with a large group and my friend and I ordered the filet mignon with black truffles on top (filetto con fonduta al tartufo) medium rare. The food came out and smelled delicious, but when I cut into the filet, it was the bluest steak I have ever seen a restaurant serve. Don't get me wrong, I can enjoy rare steak. My friend and I examined each other's filet mignons and both of our steaks were completely raw in the middle (my Ethiopian friend joked that he could eat it because Ethiopian cuisine often includes raw meat. For the record, let me remind you that La Briciola is an Italian restaurant, not Ethiopian). Not wanting to disturb my large dining group by sending the food back, I ate around the center of the steak. I am shocked that a restaurant could even serve something like that to a customer. And it wasn't just a fluke - my friend ordered the same thing and his was just as raw. Don't think I'll be coming here again.
author: Cherie L.

description: Made reservations for a party of 3 on a Saturday night. We were seated promptly after we arrived. Restaurant was half empty.  Waiters were scarce, only one working that evening.  Food came in a timely manner but found everything lightly flavored, nothing to really rave about. I guess the best part was the dessert. Small restaurant so it gets LOUD when busy. You're gonna need to scream at your friends to be heard.
author: Robert N.

description:
This place is one of my favorite Italian restaurants to go to. I may not visit it often as I would like, but it's always on my mind. I am always sharing and referring friends and family to this place because of the quality and portions of the food; friendly and authentic Italian staff; and romantic setting. I have always had great and memorable experiences, except on New Year's Eve.

 I was unpleasantly surprised about the surcharge on the check. It would have been fine if there was some sort of an announcement, either letting me know when the reservation was made or prior to being seated for dinner.

I didn't have this experience last year on New Year's Eve so it was such a huge surprise. I hope this doesn't happen again because I may not return. Guess I'll find out next year...
author: L T.

description:
Small piece of Italy in SF.
Really Italian owners all around the floor at all time serving Tuscan specialties! 
Great wine list, out of the tourists trap areas
Love this place
See you soon
author: Matteo R.

description: We stopped in after a Giants game for coffee and dessert, a Thursday night. Alessandro, the owner greeted us with warmth and enthusiasm. This cozy restaurant has a warm, relaxing environment. We had great coffee and each of our party enjoyed the gelato with espresso, chocolate cake, and the homemade tiramisu. After learning it was my friend's birthday, Alessandro generously supplied another desert and limoncellos for our group. I will definitely come back for an entire meal based on the excellent service and hospitality offered by this charming restaurant and its owner.
author: Kathy M.

description:
La Briciola is a nice sit down restaurant in the SoMa area with a relaxing ambiance and authentic Italian cuisine.

I arrived here with a group of 11 on a Wednesday afternoon and was promptly seated. We started off with some sparkling water and a variety of appetizers including Frittura di calamari, french fries, caesar salad, Tagliere di Salumi (like a cold cut platter with breadsticks, olives, and pickled vegetables), and Caprese sandwiches cut into bite sized pieces. The appetizers were all pretty good with the caesar salad being surprisingly good due to the high quality cheese and homemade croutons. 

A big favorite of the table was the complimentary bread which comes with bits of olive in olive oil. IT'S THE ABSOLUTE BEST!!! The bread has the softest pillowy insides in the world with a perfect crisp on the outside. The bits of olive in combination with the olive oil add so many wonderful flavors with the bread. This was by far the star of the show and the sole reason I would consider coming back.

For my entree, I ordered the Spaghetti alla Costiera which is a black ink spaghetti with mussels, clams, shrimp, squid, and cherry tomatoes in a white wine sauce. I found the spaghetti to be perfectly cooked and the seafood to be surprisingly fresh. The clams and mussels came in the shell and the shrimp were nice and plump with one shrimp on top in its shell. I found the white wine sauce to be a bit lacking in flavor however, as I couldn't really distinguish the wine flavor in the sauce. Overall, it was an excellent dish and just the right portion.
author: Joshua M.

description:
Small and cozy Italian spot for lunch with lovely and attentive service, La Briciola is a charming spot for a sit down relaxing weekday lunch. 

There's a causal feel to the atmosphere that is reflected in the straightforward menu that doesn't try too hard - straight forward dishes that are proven to work. The burrata appetizer is simply divine. Creamy fresh-pulled burrata and prosciutto served with a bright salad of arugula and cherry tomatoes. The fried calamari is tender with just the right amount of breading to keep it crispy on the outside. It's also a pretty generous portion. I can hardly walk away from any pasta carbonara and La Briciola does a pretty good version with their penne carbonara. It might be on the heavier side for lunch but the serving size is just right that you get to enjoy all the rich and fatty flavors of pancetta, cheese, eggs, and black pepper without needing to take a little nap after. 

Round it out with genuine service that is attentive without being overbearing, the simple charm of La Briciola is a welcome spot in tech-centric South Park/SoMa.
author: Jon L.

description: The servers were nice. The food was very mediocre. Ordered the sausage orchette and it was really greasy and bland. The bruschetta was mediocre--also devoid of flavor. My favorite item was the olive tapenade served gratis with the standard-issue baguette. Won't be back.
author: Samantha R.

description:
What better way to start off 2016 than to write about an Italian restaurant in San Francisco! Well, If you're in search for a romantic feel, quality Italian food, and top-notch service at very reasonable prices, "La Briciola" just might be the place for you. Located in the heart of the SOMA (South of Market) neighborhood, "La Briciola" focuses on Tuscan and Piedmontese cuisine, while serving a unique variety of their home-styled pasta dishes.

I came here with my fiancée on a cool Saturday December evening around 8:00pm. Surprisingly, parking was extremely easy to find as there was plenty of parking on nearby Stillman St. (which is almost directly under the I-80 freeway). Since we did not make reservations, I was worried if we had to wait to be seated. Luckily we were seated immediately even though it was close to a full house.

The inside is as rustic and Italian as possible which truly makes you feel as if you're actually dining in Northern Italy. The lighting was fairly dim but that's what gave the restaurant a truly ambient feel. The archways provided an upscale experience while white tablecloths graced throughout. And the waiter we had a very heavy Italian accent which gave this place even more authenticity.

As we both had an idea what we wanted to order, our waiter poured our bottle of Red Merlot that we brought from home. Do keep in mind that there is a $25.00 corkage fee. Once narrowing down our selections, I finally decided on their "Lasagna di Mare" (for $19.00). This was essentially a seafood lasagna that included a variety of crustacean specimens that included shrimp, salmon, and swordfish topped with Béchamel sauce. My fiancée goes the more traditional route by ordering their "Lasagna di Carne" which had the well-known meat ingredients. There was also a nice offering of warm bread complete with Balsamic Vinaigrette that tasted very good.

We were both pleasantly surprised that both of our lasagna entrees came out in less than 15 minutes. However, I do find that to be a little too much on the speedy side. Which worries me if they nuked it or baked it in a high-temperature oven. I did notice that the presentation wasn't the nicest looking dish; think of it as a glob of biscuits and gravy in terms of looks. But the taste was above average. The seafood didn't overpower each bite as it had the perfect amount of sauce without being under or overcooked. I also sampled a few bites of my fiancées entree as hers tasted very delicious.

Overall, I would have to say that "La Briciola" is a place that I would recommend. It may not compare to some of the more well-known Italian eateries in San Francisco but with the quaint and smaller size, it is a great place for someone looking for quality food at a decent price. Additionally, the have a generous lunch menu that offers the same offerings at reduced prices.
author: Donovan H.

description: Been here about 5 times for lunch. Convenient to South Park. Food is fresh and authentic. Staff is professional and knowledgeable. Atmosphere is muted and noise level just right to have a conversation. The pasta, in particular, tastes fresh and home made.
author: H. H.

description: Eh. I used to LOVE this place. But I haven't been for like 2 years. Food was awful. Service was painfully  slow. Bad place for a date because it literally took everyone to leave before we got attention. I'm so disappointed.
author: Andrew C.

description: We ate here the night before the San Francisco Marathon.  What a gem! We split the burrata and ravioli con pomodoro as well as the sfogliatine con gamberi e asparagi. We topped our meal off with profitterolles...  Absolutely wonderful.  Thank you so much!  Would definitely recommend - off the beaten path but definitely worth it!
author: E. W.

description: Shellfish in the pasta taste funny and I ended up eat around it. My coworker order carbonara and it was half way egg scramble and oil pasta. Only good thing I can say about this restaurant is bread and olive oil and friendly servers.
author: Sarah K.

description: First timer here. The food was good but the services wasn't all that great. I've been to places like Limon Rotisserie and Berreta and the service here is nothing compare to what I've experienced. The waiters are constantly talking to customers. We had to wait roughly about 25 minutes for 2 dish of food, while the next group of customers came in and gotten theirs within 10 minute of ordering. We were tired of waiting but figure that deserts may be fast and we can just go. We sat there looking at the waiters gossip with the customers for about 15 minutes. When the group of customer left. He then approach us and ask if our desert has arrived and we told him No. He then walked to the back and grab the desert and brought it to us. If you want some decent food and a approximately 45 minute of idleing. Then this place is exactly that.
author: Dylan H.

description: This place is absolutely fantastic.  Many of their dishes feature fresh hand made pasta.  The wine selection is very good.  I highly recommend it!
author: Jose F.

description: It's a nice small restaurant in the busy streets of San Fran. The bread they served to us at the table was lovely, especially with the olive tapenade. As someone who does not go to Italian restaurants a lot, I was pleasantly surprised at how delicious everything was. The risotto was probably the best dish that I had so far. There were not a lot of people coming in and out of the restaurant, so it was a great place for people to talk leisurely. The staff are respectful and attentive; it's a lovely place!
author: Sharon H.

description: Randomly picked an Italian restaurant on the drive in to San Francisco. But I have a feeling I will be going here more often. Great service. Amazing food. I suggest the risotto.
author: John Z.

description: Less vegetarian options. The food was not so bad but the service was horrible.with very less people in the place it was taking them more than 20 minutes to attend us just to give us a menu or ask for the next course. They should improve their service . Food is not that bad.
author: Bhakti S.

description: Great food and great service. Real Italian and fresh food. Small but worth the wait. Advice to book ahead on the weekend.
author: Frank P.

description: Amazing food! The minestrone was the best I've ever had! It was so fresh and vibrant. The swordfish special was out of this world!
author: D D.

description: Update: 2 years in, and this place has tremendously improved. The lamb Ragu and chocolate soufflé are to die for!
author: Nekshad T.

description: Cool spot with very tasty food and nice staff. There are multiple versions of the menu floating around that have conflicting prices, so don't be surprised when your bill comes out pricier than expected...and pricey it is.
author: Tamir G.

description: If you're looking for an authentic Italian restaurant, you have found it with La Briciola. It is small, warm, and classy. The servers were kind, patient, and authentic Italian. You don't have to be in a hurry here - it's dining. Each dish was superb with an appropriate quantity. Begin with the delicious olive tempenade and bread. The wine list is full of wide variety of Italian wines. La Briciola is an Italian gem in SF.
author: Margo L.

description: Wonderful little Italian restaurant. Their server was so attentive and friendly and very accommodating. They bring a plentiful basket of warm bread with an olive oil and mashed olive spread to get you started. Great selection of plates with a lot of seafood options. I asked if they would make me a carbonara and very quickly our server obliged and we were set. The orders came out quickly and the portions are large but not over sized. Wonderful flavor and service with reasonable prices. Would definitely recommend.
author: Andy A.

description:
Food was decent. I wasn't very impressed with the flavors of the dishes I ordered for the steep prices.

The ambience of the restaurant is nice though. They have dim lighting and candles on each table (nice for a first date or an intimate dinner). 

The servers were polite and welcoming.

For me, the food was just lacking and that's the main reason to go out to eat. 

I tried the polpo con fagiolini e orzo appetizer. Don't order this. There was nothing about it I really enjoyed, but I honestly hate wasting food so I tried to eat most of it. The warm octopus didn't have a good texture; I felt like it would've tasted a lot better if it was grilled. It came with carrots, a bunch of onions, and a lemon dressing. Didn't like the combination of flavors at all- pass.

Next was the tagliolini di mare. This was a seafood pasta with a nice amount of mixed seafood in it. The pasta was cooked well and the seafood was good, but the sauce was definitely lacking flavor. Pasta is all about the sauce for me, so I wouldn't order this again.

My boyfriend got the gnocchi sorrentina (pomodoro sauce with mozzarella and basil). I tried his and his dish tasted the best out of everything we ordered. The sauce was tasty and the gnocchi was cooked perfectly.

All in all, I would not visit again. I've had incredible Italian food at so many other restaurants.
author: Clarissa H.

description:
We came here for lunch with a group of 10. We had a reservation and were seated right away.
Service was very friendly and the bread they serve upfront was delicious! I ordered the seafood spaghetti and was not disappointed when the food finally came. We waited for 40minutes even though the restaurant was not busy. Only 2 other tables with small groups were taken. I understand that good food needs time but for a business lunch the wait was too long.

I would give 4 stars for food and service. But the fact we waited for 40minutes for lunch is the reason for 3.
author: Michèle S.

description:
With a friend visiting San Francisco and staying in the downtown area and neeing a good dinner option, I was originally stumped on where we should meet.  Once we decided on Italian, my friend ended up making reservations for La Bricola; looking at the 4-star average review, I was looking forward to an excellent dinner.

We started off with the crostini misti di polenta, which included small circles of polenta covered individually with either chicken pâté, a porcini mushroom sauce, and a tomato-based sausage sauce.  Out of all of them, I liked the sausage one the best, but I thought that the polenta was soggy and bland.  The pâté was meh and the porcini mushrooms did not impress.

I had asked for recommendations for my entrée, and our server strongly recommended the tagliatelle with mushroom and black truffles.  If you are looking for a soupy pasta dish that was under-seasoned with overly soft noodles, this dish will meet your requirements in spades.  The chocolate cake dessert was fine but not particularly memorable. It's definitely possible that I picked the wrong items given the stellar past reviews, but I think I will pass on any future visits to La Bricola.
author: Keith H.

description:
I would give this place 3.5 stars if I could.  

- Food 4 stars
- Service 5 stars
- Ambiance, if you want lively - 2.5 stars; if you want quiet and romantic - 4 stars
- Location 3 stars

I was there on a Friday evening with a friend.  We were seated immediately as the restaurant was nearly empty.  We perused the wine menu and couldn't decide between two options.  We asked to taste both options and were graciously given a taste of each.  

After we ordered our wine, a waiter brought out a bread basket.  The bread, served warm, was delicious!  They serve it w tapenade that is very tasty, but I prefer it to have a closer oil to olive ratio - this was on the oily side.

My friend ordered the crespelle (essentially cannelloni), and I ordered the squid ink seafood spaghetti.  My pasta was very flavorful, a perfect portion (generous but not overwhelming), and had a decent amount of seafood in it.  I would have liked it to have a bit more squid perhaps.  

The biggest drawback to the place is the slightly undesirable location.  I happened to be in the neighborhood as it is between my friend's office and my office.  I wouldn't, however, have a desire to spend time in that part of SF otherwise.  It's on the border of nicer areas of SOMA, but not quite in the nicer parts as it is very close to the freeway underpass.  

I suspect this location contributed to the empty house on Friday evening, and thus a slightly less than lively atmosphere.  It would be a great place to take older parents who want a less convivial atmosphere or to go on a romantic date.
author: Sara E.

description: My husband and I came here for dinner on New Year's Eve. The energy was good, but the was better! We had gnocchi and calamari. They were both delicious! We weren't incredibly hungry after a day of eating around SF, so we took the leftovers back to our hotel. After the New Year's festivities we came back to our hotel room starving. We ate the leftovers in bed at 1 am, and they were still so good. We would definitely like to go back!
author: Lexy P.

description: The food and the service were perfect! We had the burrata, seafood pasta and lamb ragu and everything was delicious! Definitely will be back and recommend to anyone looking for an authentic Italian meal in a lovely ambiance!
author: Kelsey F.

description:
This place was great! The mood and setting was very relaxed and sophisticated. We ordered an appetizer, entrees, dessert and coffee and our bill was right at $100. At first my boyfriend ordered the Rombo All'isolana and he wasn't very happy... But we changed it out for the fileto con fonduta al tartufo which I've never seen him so happy about. It came with black truffles on the top and he sweared that the dish was melting in his mouth. He was so pleased! I ordered the involtino de spada which came with some
Really good vegetables on the side. We ended he night with their tiramisu which was of course delicious!
author: Brittani T.

description:
This place is superb! 

I came in for dinner last night and oh everything was just perfect. This little spot is easy to miss, but very lovely on the inside. 

For an appetizer I had the minestrone soup and it was soooo good. For the entrée I ordered the orrechiette and it was delicious. The pasta was a perfect al dente and the olive oil sauce was light(how I like it) with some sea salt-if you don't like salt then you might not like this. And to finish things off, the tiramisu was moist and strong(again, how I like it). 

The service was exceptional, the waiter was always available and my water was never out. 

I would highly recommend this place. It's quite romantic if you are looking for a date night spot.
author: Valerie C.

description: A little local SF gem. Always come here when craving Italian food. Great variety of pastas and a warm welcoming atmosphere. Perfect size portions where you don't leave the place stuffed but perfectly satisfied. An SF staple that I highly recommend.
author: Roxanne A.

description: Meh - the vegetarian rissoto and penne lacked the creaminess and texture that I'm used to. The bread was nice and warm :)
author: Sagar J.

description:
I reserved a table at La Briciola for a business lunch which didn't take place in the end.
The restaurant vid very cute in an European-Italian way instead of an American-Italian way ;-)
The waiter speaks Italian, even more authentic. I ordered to vegetable soup and was blown away. It's been the best it had in years. 
The tuna sandwich was good, but you'll get that money b many other places. The soup deserves 5 stars and I'm sure the other more traditional meals would as well. Will come back
author: Dario S.

description: It's an ok place. Pretty standard Italian place, nothing special but nothing bad. Service is good
author: Martha S.

description:
We've had two terrific meals there. Both times with fairly large groups. The food is terrific; sophisticated without being stuffy. Super nice staff. 
The lasagna is wonderful. The meat plate is plentiful and perfect.
author: Antonia T.

description: Came here with a friend and again with a large group, both on weekend nights. We did make reservations although we probably would have been fine without them. Service was consistently attentive and we felt very welcome. Wine list has a good selection with affordable options that were delicious. Squid ink seafood pasta accompanied by the Nero D'Avola was delicious. Highly recommend for a date or large group.
author: Michelle V.

description:
The prompt and friendly service was nice, but it didn't make me love my soggy pasta. While my tagliatelle tasted freshly made, it was overcooked and mushy. The first two bites were good, but the dish quickly turned into a huge doughy lump. My friend's squid ink pasta, on the other hand, was cooked al dente. 

If know me, then you know how I feel about flaccid things in my mouth.
author: Suany W.

description:
Food = 5+ stars! 
Host = the devil..

Alright so, this place has good reviews because it's true, the food is very good! It is probably the most authentic Italian food I have had in the US. Everything from their bread, apps and entrees to their wine selection was all right on point. 

However, the host was beyond horrible. I couldn't hardly believe how rude he was. I would go into the whole story, but I hate being THAT person. Just make sure you make a reservation even if every time on Open Table is free and the restaurant is empty... If you don't, the host will make you feel like the most insignificant person on the planet.
author: Harmony H.

description: Hands down our favorite go to restaurant for a consistently great meal, with owners and employees who care, and make you feel welcomed...every time. No matter your North Beach favorite, give this SOMA Italian restaurant a try. They will not fail you.
author: Bill G.

description:
Good points:
Nice atmosphere even with group of co-workers
Nice service
Entree portion size is good
Rabbit stew is a little bit salty for me

Bad:
Expensive salad
Restaurant has no BMG
author: Shin T.

description:
Lovely ambiance! 
We had vegetable crepe in mushroom sauce for appetizer! That was benissimo!! I really enjoyed that bit touch of truffle oil!

I had chicken with porcini as secondi Chicken breast was nicely brined and premartinated, so it turned out to be very moist! My friend had lasagna, risotto in ink sauce, sea bass ravioli. All were fantastic! Will come back!
author: Yann M.

description:
Amazing food quality housed within a tranquil upscale dining for business or pleasure. The food is divine and the place uses all homemade sauces, noodles, bread....the risotto and the lasagna is so insanely good.   I enjoyed the quaint quiet sounds of being fully able to relax and not be so rushed like many San Francisco restaurant. A friend told me about this place and I have to say it is the best choice in Italian dining. 

Great staff. Remember this isn't a family place as I saw many people their whispering versus trying to keep your kids held down :)
author: Kathy S.

description: Wonderful Italian restaurant in San Francisco.  Food was great and staff was great.  I highly recommend it!
author: Tracy P.

description: The bread and olive tapenade was great but all three of the pastas we ordered were bland and not very flavorful. The burrata was similarly bland. Surprised all the other reviews were so positive. I much prefer the pasta at Pazzia a block away
author: Jameel K.

description: Ate here on New year's Eve. Both pasta dishes under cooked (tasted doughy), salad dressing flavorless, service absent, 30% surcharge for the holiday. Bread was pretty good, and I think it had potential, perhaps an off day? Feeling generous so 3 stars
author: Matt S.

description: The pastas were very simple and light on flavor. I had the tagliatelle with truffle and porcini, sauce was light and noodles were a little dense. I had the bruschetta which was pretty good. I also tasted the swordfish which was cooked well, but again was lightly flavored. There was a very large and loud group in the back whom I was seated next to initially, but I requested a new table. The acoustics of the restaurant were poor, as conversation was almost impossible. Staff were friendly but scarce. Tiramisu was dense and heavy. I had to remind my waiter I ordered coffee after he desserts were half finished.
author: Tiffany E.

description:
I just can't recommend it. I want to introduce the executive chef to salt. The 2-star rating comes largely from the uninspired food. We had a serious blandness issue that I just couldn't get past. Positives: the spinach salad was really well dressed and light. The tiramisu was 4/5 stars.  The ambiance is warm and welcoming. Negatives: the service was blah, the bruschetta was flavorless, and the gnocchi just seamed entirely unseasoned. And it wasn't that the flavors were 'delicate' and I just wasn't sensitive enough to them. With so many great Italian places to choose from, I just can't recommend in good faith. 

My friend like the mushroom pasta. I may have just ordered poorly.
author: Fran B.

description: The staff were extremely friendly and treated us like their family. The black ink spaghetti with seafood is a very popular option here. It came with clams and a giant shrimp. The actual black ink pasta did not taste any different from regular coloured pasta.
author: James S.

description:
This is my first time at this place....
Very, very, very not bad spot :) 
Warm, nice and quiet atmosphere. The food tastes  like a homemade. Good selection of wines. 
Oh, by the way, don't forget to try a dessert ! ;)
author: Daria N.

description:
i was super duper excited to try this place because the rave reviews! and my girlfriends loveee italian food, so i wanted to show them this spot. we live really close to the place and just havent stopped by.

so. we sat down. one bottle of riesling, one bottle of sangiovese for 3 gals. going big. we order burrata while waiting for the third girl to show up. girl shows up. burrata does not. waiters dont really come by to ask how we're doing. we flag them down.  we order entrees. wait and wait. no burrata. entrees show up. waiter remembers to check on burrata - ohhh but he didnt put in our order. OOPS. does not even try to make up for it. apologizes while walking away. classy.

we ordered - pasta with truffles and mushrooms, seafood tagliolini, and the chicken entree. my noodles were STUCK TOGETHER and in a giant clump. wtf? this seems like something that would come out of my kitchen cuz i always cook too much at once. ughhhh.

will not be back. unimpressive food and service. sorry!
author: Christina L.

description:
Came here for a team lunch for about 12 people. We came about 11:30 on a Thursday. We were the first ones there and even while we were there until 1:30 pm it wasn't too busy. But the food was delicious. The waiter was very charming and helpful when we butchered our attempts at Italian. 

We ordered a lot and everyone seemed pretty satisfied with what they ordered. 

I tried the
House bread and olive oil 
Burrata - burrata with prosciutto and arugula
Spinacina - spinach salad with goat cheese and caramelized walnuts
Sfogaltina - like a seafood pot pie but with puff pastry 
Tiramisu
Panna Cotta

The people around me had the gnocchi (spinach and the gorgonzola) and the seafood pasta (sans pasta since she has to go gluten free). I loved that they accommodated her allergy easily and she said it was tasty. I didn't waste a bite and ate everything on my plate but the bread and burrata were my favorites. :) Can't wait to come back and try more.
author: Erin T.

description:
Andrea R. and I decided to go on a roomie date. Searching through yelp, we both stopped and stared at each other stumbling upon this traditional looking Italian restaurant amazed at the design and incredible food posts. Made a reservation through yelp for open table, turned on our car and sped to our candle light dinner date. 

We missed it because it was tucked on the bottom of a building near the freeway. But we just parked a block down and walked back. METER PARKING YAY....
At 5:30pm, it was completely empty and we were the first ones. It felt like to took a portal from SF straight to Italy (although i've never actually gone to italy before, I bought the whole shazaaam). After being seated our friendly waiter left us with a menu and recommendations. 

Straccietti al ragú di agnello $18: 3 stars. hand cut pasta with lamb ragú. The ragú needed a little more flavors to it because it was plain, but i just added more salt and pepper presented at our table. Wished the entire plate had more flavors actually...But the pasta you can taste the difference between hand cut and store bought. For the price I got a pretty small portion, but it was expected. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/la-briciola-san-francisco?select=2pUUIp85s6LgPxs58AgEIg#j6l6Jww92W_cs0ZgBNlZAQ

My roommate got the Crostini misti di polenta chicken  consisting of pâté,porcini mushrooms, sausage, polenta. She enjoyed her dish and I got to try some of her chicken and it was quite flavorful. 

Panna cotta $8: 4 stars. vanilla cream pudding with cherry coulis. A date would not be complete without sharing a delicious dessert! I LOVED this dessert, it was so creamy and immersed my palate with just the right amount of sweetness. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/la-briciola-san-francisco?select=2pUUIp85s6LgPxs58AgEIg#2pUUIp85s6LgPxs58AgEIg

.::Summary::.
-decent food
-a bit pricey
-small portions
-great service
-amazing atmosphere
-lovely architect
author: Chena N.

description: These Italians know their food and vino. They are also part of the Italian restaurant inner circle (yes it exists, I just got confirmation), so if you know Italian food, that should mean something to you. Plus, you'll appreciate the experience at La Briciola.
author: morgan m.

description:
Looking for a group dinner? La Briciola has a cozy little nook they can turn into a private dining area for you and your crew. But the abundance of hard surfaces in this rustic room had us all yelling at each other throughout the meal. And when you're dining together in a 'getting-to-know-you' format, it can be kind of a downer to yell "huh?" or "excuse me?" all the time. We were only 20 people speaking in inside voices, but if was LOUD. Just a few thick curtains would help soak up the sound. 

The food was very nice, with some unusual appetizers like grilled squid with chickpea puree and eggplant bruscetta, served family style. For my main dish, I had the baked halibut with fresh tomato sauce and ribbon-thin potato slices. It came in a casserole dish, hot out the oven, and the fish was buttery-tender. I tried a bite of the tempting seabass filled ravioli with lobster reduction, but it was somewhat bland - mostly pasta and very little filling. Could be my greedy American appetite, but I'm glad I went with the fish. 

Service was attentive & charming, wine glasses and water always filled, and each course came out perfectly timed. The atmosphere does feel quite Italian, and the menu has lots of promising dishes with an entirely separate menu for "from the sea" dishes. Vegequarians take note!
author: Nique F.

description:
We celebrated my brother-in-law (Jon's) birthday at La Bricola - it was a Sunday night and we had a party of 9.  I sat with my parents and husband at one end of the table, and Jon had friends and family around him at the other end. Less than a week had gone by since an accident had claimed the life of his wife, my sister, so the mood was quiet and tearful, instead of the happy and fun birthday dinner she had planned for him just days before.

A few appetizers were ordered but I only remember eating lots of crispy, fried calamari. A plate of it landed in front of me and I enjoyed tons of lightly breaded, flavorful, crunchy pieces. I also went a little crazy with the bread and olive oil on the table. Pretty sure I ate more than my fair share of all the community dishes.

For dinner my husband had lamb, served in a plateful of gravy - he ate every bite and said it was delicious.  I had a seafood pasta with squid ink, which dyed the noodles black. Seemed to appropriately fit my mood - and also looked pretty cool. It was delicious too. Lots of seafood and a great sauce. I hardly remember eating, or what anyone talked about, but I also cleaned my plate. 

Service was great - friendly without being more enthusiastic than we could handle. I think a dessert with a candle showed up at the end of the meal. Thank goodness the staff didn't include a song with the dessert. Everything was really enjoyable (as much as it could be) and I'd definitely return!
author: Amy S.

description:
Very nice ink source Risotto!
Frendry service.
Carbonara was also very nice.
author: Sotaro K.

description: One of our most favorite restaurants. Excellent food, outstanding hosts. Always a go to place.  Just celebrated our anniversary there, and the evening was delightful. Food is always excellent, and the service impeccable.
author: Terry L.

description:
Sono italiani!

*Authentic Italian food and staff
*Amazing burrata and panna cotta
*Great for lunch or dinner

This is more of a ristorante than trattoria, which means you'll find good solid food, a more refined atmosphere, yet still laid back enough to be comfortable, and quiet enough to have a conversation. 
The servers are extremely charismatic, the olive tapenade to accompany your bread is highly addictive and all the dishes we've had have been quite tasty. Their burrata is really fresh and a must for any cheese (or non cheese) lover.. semi-sad to say that I officially now start my meals with the burrata and end them with their panna cotta (with mixed berry coulis, should I say).. and a lot of happy carbs in between!

I highly recommend making a reservation as their rush hours seem to be a bit sporadic, and bring a friend or two to catch up with over a great meal ;)
Also, *briciola* means crumb... and I definitely don't have a single one left on my plate by the end of the night!
author: Jade T.

description: The most bland of all pastas possible. Friendly service, not that attentive but not terrible. Basic interior. Not a place I would write home about. Would not revisit.
author: Jackie H.

description:
Delicious!!!
The authentic Italian cuisine is here! We loved the ambiance, the olive oil, the bread, and the pasta! Reasonably priced, nice portions... very attentive wait staff. Will definitely come back here again and again!!!
author: T E.

description:
Prices are around $5 more expensive than the menu on yelp but still very reasonable.
Service was leisurely but good.
Food was great.
author: Michail Y.

description:
I thoroughly enjoyed my NYE dinner experience at La Briciola. They were easy and quick to accommodate with my group of 12 people. They're a great spot with delicious Italian cuisine, reasonable prices, and great service.

I highly recommend the Burrata to start off - great and fresh mozzarella cheese, accompanied by fine prosciutto, and a delicious arugula salad. There was not one bad thing that I tried at La Briciola amongst all the entrees that we had ordered.

I got the Sea Bass ravioli, which is rich and creamy, yet filled with tender fish. I would definitely like to go back and try more dishes.

Great job La Briciola!
author: Joyce M.

description:
It was our first time here, even though we only live two blocks away. And we will definitely be coming back. 

The lamb Ragu pasta, lasagne, Caesar Salad were all great. The pasta was al dente and sauces were rich and yummy.

The only negative was the tiramisu. You can tell it was previously frozen, due to the little water in the ladyfingers (although the flavor was good)
author: Jon H.

description:
My two most recent experiences at La Briciola have not been that great. They were so drastically different that I had to write a review update.

I went with a friend for dinner and got the polenta appetizer, which I had before. This time it was not as good. I also go the mushroom pasta, which I thought was pretty standard. How hard is it to make mushrooms taste bad? But it wasn't great. They used these button mushrooms that look liked they came out of a can. At least use some more flavorful mushrooms, I thought!

Then a month or two later, I was supposed to have dinner with two girlfriends at La Briciola. One of them made a reservation at Savored. When we got to the restaurant, we were told that the entire restaurant was booked for the evening for a private company holiday party. But umm, what about our reservation? They were pretty rude about it and wasn't apologetic at all. That was really the last straw. I'm never coming back again.
author: Sherry L.

description:
Came to La Briciola for a very very anticipated CARB loading meal night before Nike Womens Half Marathon. Made a reservation and got seated right away. The servers were very friendly. The menu wasnt very extensive but I just wanted a simple pasta. I opted for Tagliatelleai porcini e tartufo and asked if they could make it spicy! I usually end up regretting asking for the chef to add some spice at italian places because they just add a bunch of red chili flakes. The chef at La Briciola made a plain pasta taste so flavorful.. my friend wanted mine instead of her seafood spaghetti!! 

This is a cute date night spot! I will def be back :)
author: Hetal P.

description:
This is such a great place. We walked in with no reservation on a Saturday night and they accommodated our party. 
The service is really good, the waiters are extremely nice and friendly.
The food is amazing, we had calamari, lasagna and ravioli and everything was absolutely delicious!
The place is also pretty clean and has very nice atmosphere. You'd definitely be more comfortable in a dressy attire!
author: Nagham A.

description: The food is absolutely fresh and amazing... so grateful this restaurant continues to serve authentic Italian cuisine. The service and the food couldn't be more enjoyable- Brava!
author: Claudia V.

description: Its awesome! My favorite Italian restaurant in the city! The atmosphere is authentic Italian and the food is excellent! Everytime that I can I wanna go there!
author: Mery F.

description:
Great service and friendly staff! Excellent choice of food and the place was perfectly cosy and warm :)  The food is consistent and of extremely high quality - I don't think there is any bad dish at all in this place, so don't worry about what you will be getting. 

You must try the Tiramisu - I can say it's one of the best I've ever tasted, and I will be going back for more!
author: Anji M.

description: Came here for NYE after seeing the yelp stars and ordered one of my fave dishes, truffle pasta. It was horrible. Tasted like a watery TV dinner served with thick egg noodles. My bf ordered the truffle steak (medium). I had one bite and it was good but his stomach was upset after and he had the runs. The busser told me he didn't think I could switch out my pasta after I only had 2 bites (because clearly I didn't like it). Luckily I told the server and he refunded the dish. He was nice. My friend got raviolis and they were definitely nothing special (had a bite of that as well). On the other hand the arugula salad and spinach salad are really tasty and the bread with olive tapenade in olive oil was good. Also the wine was good and the restaurant had a beautiful, classy ambiance. Our server was nice but I don't think I'll be returning. They need to work on their food.
author: Natalie W.

description:
We had a very good time there. The food is excellent and the staff is warm, dynamic and friendly. We liked the ambiance and the place. Thank you guys ! 


Des assiettes bien garnies et de très bons produits.  Le vrai repas italien, un régal ! Le service était très rapide. Même le pain était très bon. 
Le personnel est attentif, dynamique  et souriant. Un vrai plaisir. L'ambiance était sympa et l'endroit chaleureux.  De quoi passer une bonne soirée ! Merci
author: Clara S.

description:
I have walked by this place for years when going to/from Giants games. a month ago when my parents were using my Giants tickets we stopped here for dinner after a pre-game drink with them.  I enjoyed it very much - and went back 2 weeks later with similar impressions.

This nice Italian dining experinece is in a strange location.  The surrounding area is not very conducive to a nice dining establishment.  So I am not sure how they survive here - but survive they do.  

The food was very good - the pasta was fresh and appeared to be home made.  The wine list contained a nice variety - though focused on Italian wines, as it should be - with reasonable prices.

Service was "European" - it wasn't rushed and it wasn't inattentive.  I thought it was just about right.  Many other review here complain about slow service.   After dining here twice with similar service, I have to wonder  if they were expecting fast food service and were not happy that their made-to-order linguini was not brought out in 10 minutes.

Personally, I was enjoying the company I was with, so a little break between the anti-pasta and the entree was perfect.  BTW, the first time I dined there, a group of 10 somewhat demanding young SF professionals sat at a nearby table.  Even though the small staff had to deal with them, our service was only mildly impacted.

Every dish we had here was made quite well.  the cost was reasonable for San Francisco.  The portions were good sized - I brought home the leftovers for lunch the next day.

I would definitely go back.
author: Jeff H.

description:
What a cozy restaurant for dinner on a rainy night!

Parking was super easy to find nearby which proved to be a huge blessing as the night turned into a downpour.

When we got in at 7:30, the place is packed. Dimly lit and warm, I instantly felt cozy inside. The bread with the olive oil + olives dip was wondering, especially the dipping. The bread though I would have preferred something more hearty but it's free bread, can't complain. For main I ordered a daily special - squid ink pasta with seafood in a white wine sauce. My friends (who are vegetarians) took one look of my plate and declared it looks like an ocean floor, with the black pasta serving as the base and assortments of mussels, clams, shrimps and calamari sprinkled on top. I throughly enjoyed the freshness and the delicate sauce. there was so much though that I couldn't finish.

What a gem of a place! It's hard to miss walking by the dismal 3rd street but give it a try.
author: Ashley Z.

description:
My big thing is simple meals done extremely well. This entire meal encapsulated that ideology.

I yelped pasta near SoMa. 
I arrived to a nearly full restaurant within which I only heard Italian being spoken. A great sign.

The waiter recommended me a fantastic wine via my stated preferences; big and bold red for my eventual lamb chop feast, but Italian please. It was so fantastic I went online the next day to buy a few bottles for my cellar. 

Will I be reviewing my caesar salad experience? You bet your ass I am. What can you do with a caesar salad? I hope you don't do much, because that is why it was perfect. Each fresh and crisp romaine lettuce leaf had the perfect amount of delicious dressing... on every piece in the entire plate. 

Risotto... Everything you want a risotto to be. Semi-firm rice morsels with a comforting proportion of cheese folded in carefully. I would change nothing.

Baked Halibut... A luxurious yet simple tomato broth bath engulfs two healthy cuts of halibut surrounded by scalloped potatoes. I drank the broth off of the dish. It was unbelievably flavorful. The fish was perfectly moist and the bath it was relaxing in did not overpower its freshness.

Lamb Chops... Like the first thing I wrote in this review, simple done extremely well. I couldn't have asked for a more perfectly cut and cooked Italian lamb chop dish. Paired with a traditional sauce and a healthy serving of vegetables, it really doesn't get much better than this. 

Tiramisu... Don't leave without trying it. 
Affogato... I always end an Italian meal with this.
author: Arman A.

description:
Nice little Italian place. Went in as a group of 6 on a Friday. I'd recommend the Cacciucco (like Cioppino the Seafood stew) & Squid ink seafood pasta. Great portions on these. Large shrimps. Perfect crunchiness on the Fried calamaris. Nice way of plating the Burrata with prosciutto but wished prosciutto were already sliced for easy sharing. Nice romantic atmosphere, love the arched pillars. Super friendly waiters, though they can be busy when it's full house. 

A bit salty on the stews if you were to sip on the soup alone, and the seashells size were a bit small on ours. Sausage pasta was on the dry side. Sea bass ravioli's portion could be bigger just like their other dishes. Squid ink risotto could work on its presentation. Tiramisu, not bad. 

Not sure about seeing the rabbit stew thing on the menu.
But would go back and to also try other stuffs in this relaxing setting. 
Tip: Would help to get yourself familiar with some Italian dishes' names before going in.
author: Leilani B.

description:
Went in for lunch with coworkers, with a group of 8.  The solid 4-star rating lead us to believe we were going to get, at minimum, a decent meal.  There must be a huge disconnect between lunch and dinner service, because our experience was just straight up poor on all aspects.  

Service: Our waiter took at least 10 minutes to show up, did not welcome us or introduce himself.  No drink orders were taken.  No explanation was given about the menu, or the specials sheet which was inserted in the menu.  Food took way too long to come out.  We asked about 20 minutes after ordering and were told "only two more minutes".  It was 18 more minutes by my watch before the food came out.  If the food is only half done (or not even started?) let us know, don't tell us "two minutes".  Additionally, the place was not very busy, and we saw three separate tables of two get seated, and get their entrees before us.  One table even had desert and left before we got our food.

Food: I ordered one of the specials which was pork loin with prosciutto, served with broccoli rabe and mashed potatoes.  The dish that came out did not match expectations.  There were three medallions of pork loin with prosciutto on top.  The slices of pork were cut and pounded so thin that they were leathery and you could not tell what kind of meat it was.  The side veggies were a broccoli carrot medley that I would guess had been frozen (NOT broccoli rabe), and roasted potatoes.  I'm usually fine with substitutions from what the menu says, but it would have been nice to be warned ahead of time.  

I couldn't help but laugh when I saw the lasagna that some of my group ordered.  Normally I picture lasagna as something that you cut a slice of, and it at least somewhat holds the shape that it was cut in to.  What showed up at our table was gloopy plate looking more like a bowl of soup than lasagna.

When we asked for a check at the end, we let the waiter know that we were displeased with both the food quality and the slowness.  He told us that it was because of the lasagna which takes 25 minutes.  Again, better communication at the time of ordering would have been great.  Also that's a deferral, not an apology.  With so many other restaurants to chose from here in SF, I can safely say I won't be coming back.
author: Steven Z.

description:
If I could assign letter grades, this place gets a solid C -

Went here today for a work lunch at noon. We did not receive our food until 1:10. We all noticed customers who arrived after us receive their food, eat, wipe their mouths, pay, and leave all before we got our food.

When we asked our waiter about our food, he said the food would come out in "two minutes." He must have been using the "two minutes" from the end of an NBA playoff game because it was another 15 minutes before the food came out. 

Then the food came out. The lasagna looked not Nonna's but some pile of mush. It also had carrots, which I found odd since it was lasagna. Others had the pork loin special with broccoli rabe. This was three pieces of pork and some frozen broccoli for the low low price of $23. Not value priced. 

At the end of the meal, the waiter asked how it was and we told him the truth. When we noted the time, he mentioned how the lasagna "takes 25 minutes"; however, it was neither noted on the menu nor did he tell us upon ordering. This would have been useful
information to know. 

The consensus of the group was that the food was salty on the whole as well. I would give this place the rating of "Santa Cruz Good" but we aren't in Santa Cruz so it is just rather mediocre.
author: Joe S.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE. The gentleman who checked us in, sweet guy with tattoos, was absolutely wonderful. Don't ever lose him! He was so friendly and attentive to our table the entire meal. The ambiance is pretty cute. Prices aren't the worst and the food was great. Loved the bread and dip before the food. Can't wait to try again!

*Definitely try the mushroom risotto, but add Pancetta to it!
author: Tiffany M.

description:
Authentic Italian as it gets. Nice people.
Speak Italian.
I'm from the east coast and I couldn't find a proper Italian dish.  Then I went here.  AWESOME. Get pasta

Nuff said
author: Pete S.

description: I came here for dinner last weekend. It's a little pricey, but the food was really great. I ordered the Straccietti al ragú di agnello (hand cut pasta~lamb ragú), which was really good! The pasta was a perfect texture, and the lamb ragu was hearty and yum. I tried some of my boyfriend's Ravioli di cernia (seabass filled ravioli~lobster reduction), which was great as well.
author: Cynthia M.

description: Came here with a group of friends on a sunday night. We wanted a great meal to end the weekend, and yes this place was a great choice! All of us got a variation of a pasta dish and we all loved it. I could not pronounce any of the dish names but the one i got was ear shaped pasta with rapini, sasuges and olive oil. I loved how my dish was not saucy at all, and the bitterness of rapini perfectly complimented the olive oil!
author: Andy A.

description: Pricey but very classy. We walked in with no reservation for dinner on Mother's Day and managed to get seated immediately. They begin by serving warm bread with fresh olive oil. Very large wine selection, but we did not personal order any. We did order the arugula salad and minestrone soup, which both had good sized portions and tasted delicious! For our main entrees we ordered the lasagna and ravioli. The ravioli only came with 7-8 pieces so I was disappointed with that portion. The portion of the lasagna was generous. Overall a delicious restaurant but on the pricier range!
author: Diana F.

description: Unbelievable ! Very authentic ,, the Polpo con fagiolini e orzo / warm octopus was unreal . The real deal without going to the North End
author: John B.

description:
Came here for dinner on a Friday evening at around 630pm and was surprised to find the restaurant rather empty. There were a couple of tables with Giants fans, which wasnt surprising since it was game night and AT&T park is just nearby. 

Service was very fast and efficient, but somehow lacked personal touch. I felt like we were being rushed and chased out of the restaurant, instead of being able to enjoy our food and conversation.

Tagliolini di mare - The fresh pasta had a good texture. The sauce was also good, but unfortunately the seafood was not fresh at all :(  

Disappointing experience!
author: Christina N.

description: We came here by accident as I got restaurant names mixed up - but this was a happy accident as this was quite a memorable meal!  Real Italian food with real Italian waiters - nice!  I had the charcuterrie, which was a nice selection all to myself with thin breadsticks, olives and marinated vegetables.  Loved it!  Then, I had the spinach and ricotta ravioli - I love ravioli - and this was definitely a tasteful, savory, lovely dish that I could not get enough of with a nice glass of Montepulciano.  Service was so friendly and sweet, and we had a nice table by the front window to enjoy the evening sun.  I would definitely come back! I'm glad I found you!
author: Maile N.

description: Excellent and cordial Italian place and food. Alessandro the owner treats you very pleasantly and if you speak Italian with him he will be even nicer. Tried in two different times the seafood pasta with lot of various seafood. Also tried the rabbit--excellent.
author: Ed P.

description: Love this place. I'm a regular been coming here for over 4yrs. The service is super. They welcome very warmly. Immediately delish bread and tapenade in olive oil is served.
