description: Just went for my second time last night, and was again not disappointed. Wonderful, intimate atmosphere and delicious, fairly priced food.  The location means parking is pretty easy too, and easy in/out on the freeway if you've got people coming in from other parts of the bay.
author: Ryan B.

description:
As others have said, i REALLY wanted to like this place.  we are always on the lookout for a good italian restaurant, and this one is just a few blocks from where we live.
sadly, this place was disappointing.
we ordered mussels to start, and 2 pasta dishes.  the dishes were very mediocre.  the lobster ravioli was a bit oversalty, and the lobster overcooked. We ordered the ragu as well, which was just ok.  
the food was not bad, but nothing special -- however, given the relatively high prices, "not bad" is not good enough.
also, perhaps I have just become spoiled by making fresh pasta at home, but the pasta itself did not taste light and delicate as fresh pasta should.
author: Derek W.

description: The atmosphere is very nice.  Families, and dates having intimate dinners surrounding a very modern beautiful bar area.  Great service, great food, but small portions.  If you have trouble finding it, it is somewhat tucked away from the hustle and bussel.  So keep your eyes out.
author: Rachel S.

description: Authentic Italian food and great selection of seafood dishes.  The place is a real neighborhood gem.  However it can be very loud at times and there are very few waiters.  The food is very flavorful and I guess that's what matters most.  However the prices of wines are outrageous.  They serve wine by the glass, $9 a glass for a bottle that costs $10 at the Wine Club nearby.
author: Laurent G.

description: I went to La Briciola last week and I really enjoyed it! Soma is definitely lacking quaint Italian restaurants - so I was really happy to see this restaurant open. The food was great and the service was superb. I ordered the gnocci which was delicious and the wine that the waiter chose for me was perfect. I'd highly recommend this place and I'm looking forward to going again.
author: Lauren R.

description: I have been here twice and it was excellent both times. Great vegetarian and seafood options as well,  good and friendly service. Try the vegetarian crepe, the gnocci, rack of lamb, and tuna...all especially good. will definitely be back to try everything else...
author: Deepa S.

description: a small restaurant that is very hidden below the freeway.  definitely a hidden gem. great service.  very friendly staff. food was great.  could've used a tiny bit more flavor, but still very good.  restaurant is definitely worth checking out at least once.
author: paul k.

description:
What's not to love about La Briciola!
My husband and I LOVE Italian Food and very picky with restaurants we go to, and La Briciola EXCEEDED our expectations in EVERYTHING - The Atmosphere, The Food, The Staff... even my 3 years old daughter is in love with this place!!! If I am dining out in SF, LA Briciola will be the place for us to go! We will drive all the way from South Bay to come to La Briciola!!!! AWESOME PLACE!!!
author: Jo J.

description: very delicious food , friendly waiters, good ambience
author: Neda M.

description: I just hosted a birthday party for a medium group at La Briciola. The hostess I spoke to on the phone was wonderful, and assisted me in planning the event over email. We were given a large table in a semi-private room, and a custom prix fixe menu printed for our guests. The delicious menu included 3 courses, and yet was very affordable. Everyone came away feeling well-fed and pampered, and the ordering and serving process went very smoothly due to all the advanced planning.
author: Christine M.

description: Amazing food and great people! I strongly recommend for everyone!!! Please everyone, try the mushroom truffle sauce  . . . I have never had anything that good before ymmm.
author: P S.

description: I went here with my girlfriend and her brother recently, and I was blown away with the quality of the food.  My group ordered the seafood platter and a steak/potato dish with a Caesar, and it was all outstanding.  I'm actually not much of a seafood person, but the seafood platter made me a true believer.  The broth it came in, alone, requires five stars.  The quality and presentation of everything we ordered was top-notch, and the atmosphere and wait staff were equally brilliant.  I definitely plan on going back, and I think you should, too.
author: Robert P.

description: Nice cozy ambiance, mediocre everything else.  My friend's vegetable crepe was surprisingly delicious.  I had the linguine alle vongole and the pasta came out abnormally salty. :(
author: S L.

description:
We went to dinner here last night and it was DELICIOUS - it tasted and felt like we were back in Italy!

The location is not great - as you drive up you may think...is this the right place but the second you walk in the door it feels like home - or a small tratorria in Italy.  Everything we ate was great from the crostini and caprese salad to the ravioli and chicken.

Service was also outstanding and this is definitely a restaurant to try!
author: Alexis P.

description:
We ate at La Briciola on a Sunday and it was lovely. The place is very tastefully decorated with comfortable seating and soft lighting. The service was friendly and efficient and the food was very good. Our table had 3 pasta dishes, a roasted half-chicken,  grilled calamari and the arugula salad. The salad and the grilled calamari were top-notch. The calamari came with a chic pea puree and a small arugula salad which worked really well together. The pasta sauce could have used a bit more salt but the ravioli were delicate and delicious. The roasted chicken was a tad dry but still very good.
If I'm in the neighborhood again I would definitely go back. There were so many menu items that sounded wonderful.
author: Maria F.

description: Good place for being in the South Beach/SoMa area. Took quite a bit of time to get our grub out to us on a Saturday night but the food itself was fantastic.
author: Ian B.

description:
This place has become my go to Italian restaurant.  The food is just great, my boyfriend and I always order three dishes to share plus a dessert! The pasta dishes are cooked just right, al dente the way I like it, and the sauces aren't overwhelming, they add enough to coat the pasta and accent  the other ingredients. 

As of right now my favorite dishes have to be the Ravioli di cernia seabass filled ravioli~lobster reduction and the Linguine cinque terre  pesto~string beans~potatoes (add mushrooms).  

The Linguine alle vongole fresh clams~white wine reduction was good but I had a clam that was filled with sand still, therefore I had to give 4 vs. 5 stars, but other than that all other dishes we have tried were very tasty and satisfying. 

Also if you are looking for a restaurant to accommodate a large group for dinner I would not recommend this restaurant, there isn't enough space and they aren't heavily staffed to meet the needs of a large group.
author: Nann M.

description: Wonderful service, food, and wine. We were extremely pleased with every part if our experience. It is not a casual dress plce like many of the reviews say.
author: Katie Y.

description: What an excellent experience! A took a foodie friend of mine to this spot near my office after reading the rave reviews here on Yelp! and we were not disappointed. The dishes were well balanced and delicious, the wine list was impressive, the service was pleasant and knowledgeable, and the atmosphere was welcoming and peaceful. Definitely going back!
author: James W.

description: Everything was awful!  From the location of this place to the service, to the food, it was one BIG waste of money and of our precious time in SF.  Nothing we ate felt fresh - the cheese platter we ordered which claimed to be an assortment of cheeses was a shamefully small variety of cheeses you can buy at your local grocery store and the waiter just put it on the table w/o explaining what kind of cheeses they were.  When I asked him, he gave a nothing description of them and even thought the swiss cheese was a parmesan cheese!!   It was shameful.  The restaurant is pretty, but that is all it has going for it.  We had to wait forever for our main meal to come - by that point, we were barely hungry because if you wait long enough, your body just assumes you're done.  The pasta was swimming in sauce = it was gross!  Everything is totally overpriced, especially because everything is just gross and very poor quality.  I don't get what everyone here is raving about.  Don't make the same mistake we made!   SF is filled with much better restaurants!!
author: D S.

description: Some friends spoiled me for a birthday dinner by taking me to La Briciola and it was definitely a culinary highlight of the last few months. I had the lamb, the BF had the fish, another friend had the filet and everyone was thrilled with their order. There were some noticeable lulls in the conversation because we were so busy devouring our food. The service was excellent and they let us linger there talking for hours after the meal, staying past closing time to let us finish without making us feel rushed. There was a birthday party at another table and it seemed like a comfortable place for a larger group, where everyone still had the luxury of being able to hear each other talk. This is definitely a wonderful new addition to SOMA and I can't wait to come back!
author: Cher E.

description: I came back here with a friend a few weeks after my initial review. She works closer to downtown, so we had to find a midpoint meeting spot for lunch. Food quality remains unchanged from the last visit (read as: not much in quantity but it's relatively delicious and leaves you full but not bloated). However, the waiter that served us this time around was much friendlier and more attentive to us than when I was here with my coworkers, so +1 for that. This isn't to say that the service last time was subpar, but I felt the waitress that served my coworkers and me last time wasn't as approachable as the waiter I had this time around.
author: Erin W.

description: Delicious Italian food, with a friendly atmosphere.  The truffle risotto was amazing!
author: Greg S.

description: the minestrone soup and their bread with the olive oil was excellent. the arugula was fresh with a great kick to it. my baked halibut had a fantastic sauce and though the fish was perfectly cooked i dont think i was crazy about the egg layer on top : it was too much of a conflicting flavor profile. the Tagliatelle ai porcini e tartufo  wild porcini~black truffles~white truffle oil was simply divine but you have to be into pasta's without a sauce. the burrata was good but i have had better although the balsamic was amazing. and finally the tiramisu was purely heaven on earth !!
author: King B.

description: The Briciola was great!  We decided to get an early dinner and enjoy one last good dinner before heading home!  We enjoy trying new Italian restaurants in the different towns we visit and coming here for dinner was a good choice!  As we arrived we were warmly greeted and seated.  I enjoyed the look of the restaurant from the soft yellow background enhanced by the rich brown wood trimmings and flooring and decorations, to the unique flower art hanging alongside the yellow walls. For starters, they bring you some bread with a kalamata olive tapenade in olive oil.  Yummy! I got the lamb ragu with hand cut pasta.  The sauce in the ragu was very flavorful; just the right amount of 'lambiness', finely diced carrots and celery; tasted like the ragu had simmered for a good amount of time and comforting!  The pasta was also very good and complimented the lamb ragu sauce just right.  I would recommend this place for it's food, service, and authenticity!
author: Caro D.

description: Amazing and delicious!  The services is fabulous!!!!!  We loved it so much that we moved our rehearsal dinner there and bought out the restaurant!  The tone they set was just like the owners....elegant & welcoming!! The candles and flowers set a warm ambiance that all our guest enjoyed!!!
author: Melissa F.

description: Quaint Italian restaurant in SOMA with above average food, service and atmosphere.  We went with a group of 8 and they were very accommodating - even though we changed the time and number of people an hour before our reservation.  Everyone had the pasta, which was very good, however they have other non-pasta dishes that looked good too. The waiters were attentive and got our table served quickly. Parking in this part of SOMA is easy to find which adds to the experience.
author: Mat J.

description: My wife and I had a terrific dinner here last night..  Service and ambiance was excellent, and equally matched by the food.  We had the warm seafood salad as an appetizer and then a gnocci lamb dish as well as a seafood ravioli for the main dishes.. All were excellent.   We got to chatting with our waiter and learned he was the owner as well. It was very obvious he took great pride in his restaurant and it showed, from the food all the way to the bus-boy service. Would definitely recommend it.
author: tom m.

description: I went here for my friends' after-wedding brunch. The service was awesome. They brought us complimentary peach cider for a much deserved toast and were very accommodating to our party. The was equally as impressive. I got the penne pasticciate al ragú and it was delicious! I will definitely come back soon.
author: Claire G.

description: After eating there several times for lunch, I recently held a private party for 20 people at La Briciola. Not only was the food outstanding but the staff there was so nice and accommodating and the prices were beyond reasonable. They have a great selection of wines and entrees. My guests especially liked the puff pastry with asparagus and shrimp appetizer and the lamb ragu. The food is prepared perfectly and the interior design is inviting. There is plenty of parking around although the block where the restaurant is located is somewhat dirty and noisy due to traffic- but hey, it's city living. I highly recommend this place for lunch, dinner or a private function. You will not be disappointed!!
author: Christine S.

description:
what a charming little place for a group lunch or a break from the office, eh? 

very attentive and authentic service (our server spoke Italian, had great recommendations, and was super helpful). i had some sort of pasta with marinara and sausage. it was hearty and good, but i was jealous of my coworkers who got the carbonara with linguine....so rich...so delicious.

it's a little pricey for the everyday-lunch, but not too bad for a nice treat.
author: Cameron J.

description: killer linguine. this is a great quiet, classy, almost senior-citizen-y place for lunch.
author: John M.

description: Went here with friends and our kids (ages 6 and 8).  While there is no kids menu, the waiters were very accommodating with custom plates of pasta and sauce.  Food was tasty, waiters were attentive, prices are fair.  Restaurant is small, quaint and elegant.  Will definitely go again.
author: Kristen V.

description: Very excited to have a new Italian restaurant where that big tomato used to be. Also, very excited that the lunch menu is very affordable for such a charming, sit-down place. The food I've ordered has been nice but not remarkable. The bucatini amatriciana has some uncalled-for herb in it, and the veggie sandwich could take some tips from Caffe Centro down the street. But, hey, the place just opened, and I'm happy to try La Briciola every coupla weeks to see how it evolves.
author: Midori S.

description: walked a few blocks here after a giants game and they were nice about our (lack of) attire =).  had the lobster ravioli and cleaned the plate.  the dessert was also delicious.
author: T Y.

description: Excellent Italian for the Bay Area.  We had the crab pasta and the halibut.  Both were delicious and had a lot of flavor.  The halibut was little over salted and the bread was just adequate -- otherwise this would place would get 5 stars.  Wonderful service and a warm, friendly atmosphere.
author: Carole C.

description: Fantastic food and top-notch service. Highly recommended. Kid-friendly as well.
author: Ashish S.

description: Nice hidden gem of an Italian restaurant in SoMa. Not your typical SoMa slick restaurant but one that would be better found in North Beach. Service was very good...attentive and good suggestions when asked. Food is not overly complex or edgy...very traditional and well put together. Everything tried by my date and I were very tasty..zuppa, carpaccio, risotto, etc. And the clincher for us was that we were able to make reservations on OpenTable about 45 minutes before we arrived. Lucky for us we nabbed one of the few remaining tables. Will definitely go back again when looking for authentic Italian food at very good prices.
author: michael N.

description: Great authentic neighborhood Italian resturant. Elegantly designed, amazing food and exellent wine list; all with out the stuffy atmosphere.
author: Rachael G.

description: My family and I came here for my Mother's birthday and it was phenomenal.  The staff was helpful and very kind.  The food was excellent.  No one had anything bad to say about a single dish we ordered!  I strongly recommend the swordfish!  I will continue to return and tell my friends.
author: Katy P.

description: the food. the service and the atmosphere are great! only there r not enough waiter and i waited for more than 30 mins for the main courses
author: pineapple b.

description: fantastic food, fantastic service. Very authentic, very warm and welcoming. I highly recommend this restaurant, you can't go wrong and will always be greeted with a smile. 5 stars for sure.
author: rebecca p.

description: What a nice addition to the nabe. Very reasonably priced and tasty lunch menu. Waiter/owner is a sweetheart...
author: Daniel B.

description: My husband said his food was great, mine was only OK.  But my main complaint was this: they deliberately prop open the restaurant's doors so that all the traffic noise, including motorcycles and trucks and other really loud, conversation-killing street noises, blast into the restaurant and kill any hope of a nice atmosphere or a pleasant evening.  I was meeting friends I hadn't seen in years, but couldn't really catch up because of this completely unnecessary traffic noise.  I don't understand.  You would think that restarauteurs would understand that one of the things they're providing is a venue for people to meet and talk to each other.
author: Victoria P.

description: being a north beach resident, i rarely have the need to go outside the 'hood--and depart from my fav place--for great italian food. well, that rule has changed. my friend and i dined opening night, which can be rough for a new restaurant, and the staff, food, drink and atmosphere were spot on.  we enjoyed the delicious onsite-made pasta with potatoes and green beans as well as the al dente ravioli after an appetizer of fresh mozzarella, ripe tomatoes and superb balsamic. in some italian restaurants, the dessert offering is limited and predictable. i delighted--and was tortured--by the too-many-to-choose-from options. luckily i was there with a buddy so we could share two delicious treats: the custard and profiterole. perfection. the authenticity of the well-made food and welcoming staff will definitely get me out of my north beach routine.
author: R L.

description: nice decor...enjoyed the quaint, italian feel where the servers all came from different parts of italy.  the halibut was tasty but wished the portion was a tad larger so i could savor the taste...la briciola is worth a try~
author: M R.

description: i agree with scott c.'s review.  i was led astray with yelp for this place.  it was ok.  service was good but the food was very average or below average in my eyes.  the pasta was either overcooked or undercooked and lukewarm when it came out.  i was hoping for a better experience.  the service was good but besides that, i don't think i would be venturing back to la briciola anytime soon.  i don't know, perhaps it was just a night where they were "off" with their execution?  regardless, i don't think i will attempt to try again since there are so many others that i would like to try.  i think it says a lot when i left and couldn't even remember what everyone ordered/ate or what i had to be honest since it was that un-impressionable.  :(  i wish them the best of luck but honestly, i've had much better...i would give them 2.5 stars at most.  definitely not 4 stars considering we ended up spending about 50/pp and the food was sub-par.
author: vivian y.
